alert.note: Alert for Dundy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 9:59PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, northwestern Cheyenne County in northwestern Kansas and western Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska through 930 PM MDT/1030 PM CDT/... At 859 PM MDT/959 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northeast of Wray, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Yuma County in northeastern Colorado, northwestern Cheyenne County in northwestern Kansas and western Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska, including the following locations... Parks, Laird and Alvin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT/midnight CDT/ for northeastern Colorado. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 300 AM MDT/400 AM CDT/ for northwestern Kansas...and southwestern Nebraska.
